oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Soldiers

United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Granbury, Hiram Bronson, 1831-1864; Fort Donelson, Battle of, Tenn., 1862; Franklin, Battle of, Franklin, Tenn., 1864
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bust portrait of a young Hiram Bronson Granbury.

H. B. (Hiram Bronson) Granbury (1831-1864) was born in Waco, Texas. He served at Fort Donelson, where he was captured but then freed in a prisoner exchange. He served at Chickamauga and Missionary Ridge and was one of the six Confederate generals killed during the Battle of Franklin in 1864.
